channel.title: the Church of Saint Clement's Podcast
channel.description: This is the podcast of the Church of Saint Clement in Alexandria, Virginia. Saint Clement is a dynamic Episcopal Church located in Northern Virginia which opens its doors and hearts to all of God's children. All are welcome at the Lord's Holy Table! See us on Facebook: Church of Saint Clement and Twitter: saintclementva.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Give it a listen!
channel.itunes:author: st clement

item.title: the Trinity
item.description: This sermon, by the Reverend Cynthia Park, was recorded on June 3, 2012 at the Church of Saint Clement in Alexandria, Virginia. It is preceded by the gospel of John (3:1-17)as proclaimed by the Reverend John D. Hortum, Rector of the Church of Saint Clement. At the Church of Saint Clement, ALL are welcome at the Lord's Holy Table. For more information, follow us on Facebook @ Church of Saint Clement or on Twitter @ Saintclementva.

item.title: Love for All: the Ethiopian Eunuch
item.description: This sermon, by the Reverend John D. Hortum, Rector of the Church of Saint Clement, was recorded in Alexandria, Virginia on May 6, 2012. It is proceeded by the gospel of John as proclaimed by the Reverend Cynthia Park. In a time in which human relations have entered more prominently than ever into the national discourse, Reverend Hortum's explanation of John's gospel, which draws directly on the teachings of Saint Clement of Alexandria himself and the story of the Ethiopian Eunuch from the day's first lesson (Acts 8:26-40), is worthy of prayer and reflection. At the Church of Saint Clement, ALL are welcome at the Lord's Holy Table. For more information, follow us on Facebook @ Church of Saint Clement or on Twitter @ saintclementva.

item.title: Good Sheperd Sunday 2012
item.description: This sermon, by Ms. Leslie Steffensen, was recorded at the Church of Saint Clement in Alexandria, Virginia on April 29, 2012. Ms. Steffensen is a senior seminarian at the Virginia Theological Seminary and a candidate for Holy Orders for the Diocese of Virginia. It is preceded by the gospel of John as proclaimed by the Reverend Shirley Porter. Reverend Porter is also a senior seminarian at the Virginia Theological Seminary and a deacon from the Diocese of Atlanta. At the Church of Saint Clement, ALL are welcome at the Lord's Holy Table! For more information, follow us on Facebook at: Church of Saint Clement or on Twitter at: Saintclementva.

item.title: He's Got the Whole World in His Hand
item.description: This sermon, by the Reverend John D. Hortum, Rector of the Church of Saint Clement, was recorded in Alexandria, Virginia on Earth Day 2012 (April 22, 2012.) It is preceded by the gospel of Luke as proclaimed by Deacon Shirley Porter of the Diocese of Atlanta. At the Church of Saint Clement, ALL are welcome at the Lord's Holy Table. For more information, follow us on FACEBOOK @ Church of Saint Clement; on Twitter at: Saintclementva.

Facebook: Church of Saint Clement; Twitter: Saintclementva Happy Easter - He is risen!

item.title: Doctor Pepper, Cheese Grits and Jesus
item.description: This sermon, by the Reverend Cynthia Park (Candidate for Holy Orders, Diocese of Virginia) was recorded at Saint Clement on the last Sunday in Lent, March 25, 2012. It is preceded by the gospel of John (12:20-33) as proclaimed by Deacon Shirley Porter of the Diocese of Atlanta. At the Church of Saint Clement, ALL are welcome at the Lord's Holy Table. For more information, follow us on Facebook @ Church of Saint Clement or on Twitter @saintclementva.

item.title: YouTube, Jesus & the Law
item.description: This sermon, by the Reverend John D. Hortum, Rector of the Church of Saint Clement, was recorded in Alexandria, Virginia on February 12, 2012. It is proceded by the gospel of Mark (1:40-45) as proclaimed by Ms. Shirley Porter, a Deacon from the dioceses of Atlanta who is a senior seminarian at the Virginia Theological Seminary. The YouTube video mentioned can be seen at: http://youtu.be/1IAhDGYlpqY. At the Church of Saint Clement, ALL are welcome at the Lord's Holy Table. For more information, follow us on Facebook at CHURCH OF SAINT CLEMENT VA or on Twitter at Saintclementva.
